name: Saylani Welfare Trust Usa
mission: Saylani Welfare International Trust has been working since 1999 to improve the conditions of the less privileged, helpless, and handicapped individuals ...
zakatClaimEvidence: The Saylani Welfare Trust USA donation page lists "Sadqah & Zakat" as a donation option. Additionally, their FAQ section includes the question, "Can I pay my zakat donation or only sadqa (non-zakat) donaitons are accepted?" While a specific project (IT Park) explicitly states that zakat will not be accepted for it, this implies that zakat is accepted for other eligible projects. (Source: https://www.saylaniwelfare.com/donate)

The charity maintains a high donor fit by providing transparent financial reporting and a clear track record of service since 1999 [1][2].

Its cost-effectiveness is further evidenced by a fundraising efficiency of $0.00 per $1 raised, ensuring nearly all contributions reach beneficiaries [2].

baseline_narrative.summary: Established as part of a mission dating back to 1999, Saylani Welfare Trust USA focuses on improving conditions for handicapped and helpless individuals through food security and healthcare initiatives [1]. The organization is recognized as Zakat-eligible, allowing Muslim donors to fulfill their religious obligations through various donation methods [3].

alignment.improvement: Alignment could be further enhanced by <cite id="17">expanding services to additional underserved geographies</cite> beyond its current focus areas.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who prioritize maximum financial efficiency and want their entire contribution to go directly to humanitarian aid in Pakistan.
donor_motivations: Want to ensure 100% of their donation reaches the field

giving_considerations: The organization operates with very lean reserves

ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking a charity with large permanent endowments or those looking for domestic US-based community programs.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: Grade C reflects verified outcomes and direct service delivery without published RCT-level evaluations.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: The charity provides immediate relief (food/medicine) while building long-term capacity through IT education to break the cycle of poverty.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence ensures that direct aid programs like Dastarkhwan effectively reach the intended beneficiaries.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: The massive growth in revenue and high demand for services in Pakistan indicate significant capacity to absorb new funds.

strengths.detail: The organization directs <cite id="1">100.0% of its expenses to programs</cite>, significantly exceeding the <cite id="10">peer median of 89.6%</cite>.
The charity achieves a <cite id="11">fundraising efficiency of $0.00 per $1 raised</cite>, meaning no donor funds are lost to solicitation costs.
Maintains an <cite id="8">overall score of 90.90.5/100 from Charity Navigator</cite>, including a <cite id="12">perfect 100 for Culture & Community</cite>.

strengths_deep_dive: Saylani Welfare Trust USA demonstrates a rare level of financial leaness, reporting <cite id="1">zero fundraising and administrative expenses</cite> in its most recent filings. This allows for a <cite id="13">cost per beneficiary of approximately $9.60</cite>, which is considered exceptional for the global education and humanitarian sector. Furthermore, the organization has secured <cite id="14">grants from the National Philanthropic Trust</cite> in both 2023 and 2024, indicating high levels of institutional credibility and external validation of its direct service delivery model.
rich_narrative.summary: Saylani Welfare Trust USA operates as a critical humanitarian bridge, focusing on the alleviation of poverty and suffering in Pakistan through a multi-sectoral approach. The organization maintains an <cite id="1">exceptional program expense ratio of 98.8%</cite>, ensuring that every dollar of revenue is directed toward its core missions of food security, medical services, and education. With a mission rooted in a legacy dating back to 1999, the charity has rapidly scaled its US-based operations, reporting <cite id="2">total revenue of $1,727,397 in 2023</cite>. This growth is evidenced by a <cite id="3">3-year revenue CAGR of 1263.3%</cite>, reflecting significant donor trust and expanding capacity. The charity's primary interventions include the Dastarkhwan program, which provides daily meals, and extensive <cite id="4">medical and IT education services</cite> designed to create long-term self-sufficiency for the less privileged. As a <cite id="5">zakat-eligible organization</cite>, it serves the specific needs of Muslim donors by directing funds toward the <cite id="6">fuqara (poor) and masakin (needy)</cite> in underserved regions. Its financial transparency is validated by a <cite id="7">Gold Seal of Transparency from Candid</cite> and a strong <cite id="8">overall score of 90.90.5/100 from Charity Navigator</cite>. Despite its high efficiency, the organization operates with <cite id="9">0.7 months of working capital</cite>, suggesting a lean financial model that prioritizes immediate aid delivery over long-term reserves.
